snippet: President Hamid Karzai’s pause before responding to the Taliban’s decision to open a political office raised doubts about his willingness to play a secondary role in the reconciliation effort.
abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai says he welcomes the Taliban's announcement that they plan to pursue peace negotiations by opening a political office in Qatar, but he takes almost a full day to respond, raising doubts about his willingness to play a secondary role in the reconciliation effort.

byline.original: By MATTHEW ROSENBERG and GRAHAM BOWLEY

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai’s pause before responding to the Taliban’s decision to open a political office raised doubts about his willingness to play a secondary role in the reconciliation effort.

headline.seo: Afghan Leader, Karzai, Warily Accepts U.S.-Taliban Talks
headline.main: Karzai Gives a Lukewarm Welcome to Taliban Talks
headline.print_headline: Karzai Hesitantly Agrees To Taliban Negotiations
